keyMoments.description: Usopp officially joins the Straw Hat Pirates as their sniper and fourth crew member, expanding the core team.
keyMoments.significance: Adds the crew's designated sniper and represents continued growth toward building a complete pirate crew capable of reaching the Grand Line.

keyMoments.description: The crew receives the Going Merry ship as a gift from Kaya, giving them their first proper vessel for their journey.
keyMoments.significance: The Going Merry becomes the crew's home and transportation, enabling them to truly begin their journey as a pirate crew. This ship serves them until the Enies Lobby arc.

keyMoments.description: The Straw Hats successfully defeat Captain Kuro and the Black Cat Pirates, protecting Syrup Village.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates the crew's growing strength and their commitment to protecting innocent people, even when not directly threatened.

keyMoments.description: The crew departs Syrup Village aboard the Going Merry with their new member Usopp, continuing their journey.
keyMoments.significance: Concludes the Syrup Village arc and sets the stage for the next adventure.

keyMoments.description: Captain Kuro is defeated by Luffy's Gomu Gomu no Kane technique, ending his three-year plan to steal Kaya's fortune.
keyMoments.significance: Marks the defeat of the crew's leader and the failure of their scheme against Syrup Village.

keyMoments.description: Second-in-command Jango is defeated by Usopp and Zoro and left unconscious in the forest.
keyMoments.significance: Eliminates the crew's second leader, though Jango is separated from the crew.

keyMoments.description: The remaining Black Cat Pirates take their defeated captain's body and flee the island, ending their threat to the village.
keyMoments.significance: Concludes the Black Cat Pirates' role in the Syrup Village arc. Their fate after this remains unknown in canon.

keyMoments.description: Usopp formally disbands his childhood 'pirate crew' consisting of Piiman, Ninjin, and Tamanegi as he prepares to join the Straw Hat Pirates.
keyMoments.significance: Marks Usopp's transition from playing at being a pirate with children to becoming a real pirate. Represents his growth and readiness to leave childhood behind.
